website_summaries.verdict: When it comes to running cooler and protecting your transmission, an affordable 32-oz. bottle of Royal Purple easily outperforms the competition.
pros: Goes a long way to extend the life of your transmission
Compatible with other automatic transmission fluids
May reduce temperature of fluid by 20°F

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth the money to give your Transmission a new life!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. I've used Royal Purple products since they where created. at 65000 I swapped all my trans fluid for Amsoil which was a good product. 155,000 I decided to go with Royal purple. All I can say is "WoW"! Improved acceleration, smoother operation, stronger shifts, and reduction is lag when going from cruising to max acceleration. My son did this same swap to his car, with the same results.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Smooth shifting, cooler transmission temp
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a 2010 F-150 5.4. I changed all fluid on advice from Royal Purple. Better shifts, especially into first gear when coming to a stop. I have a six speed transmission. Also the temp did drop on the gauge so it runs slightly cooler. All shifts are smoother. Not saying that just because its a little expensive and its wishful thinking. I am a pessimist so....It really does shift smoother. If you like to hang on to your truck/cars for a long time this will be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: jbo

customer_reviews.title: RP Makes the BEST fluids....hands down!
customer_reviews.text: This Royal Purple Max ATF is the best trans fluid money can buy. I run RP fluids in my engine, transmission, transfer case, and both front and rear differentials. All of their products are way beyond standard fluids. I had to replace my auto trans gasket due to it leaking and replaced all the fluid with the Max ATF. Prior to the fluid change, my transmission was a bit clunky going in and out of gear. With the trans fluid changed to RP it no longer clunks and it shifts smoother than ever. If you haven't made the switch to royal purple for anything fluid related, spend the extra money and buy the best!
customer_reviews.author: krivs388

customer_reviews.title: I did not notice any better shifting as some people have suggested would happen but ...
customer_reviews.text: My transmission has not exploded yet so it appears to be working! I did not notice any better shifting as some people have suggested would happen but overall this oil works as intended!
customer_reviews.author: Quentin Edward Moore

customer_reviews.title: Was skeptical but a believer in RP ATF now I guess.
customer_reviews.text: 2012 JK, 100k miles. Changed filter and topped off with 4 quarts. Noticeable difference in the way it shifts, very smooth, I’m impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Trace3rd

customer_reviews.title: and started seeing consistently ~3MPG better in all my vehicles
customer_reviews.text: RP is one thing that I swear by. I switched to RP in both my oil and transmission 3 years ago, and started seeing consistently ~3MPG better in all my vehicles, even with stretching oil changes out to every 7,500. (RP says every 10,000 is their recommendation for Oil) I'm at 280,000 miles in my CVR and I'll use this in all my cars from now on. Considering that I change it half as often as with any other oil, it is more than worth the increased price.
customer_reviews.author: G Ross

customer_reviews.title: Royal Purple = BEST for my Jeep Wrangler ATF
customer_reviews.text: I drained as much transmission fluid as I could from the Jeep Wrangler JK and replaced it with this RP fluid. My tranny was shifting a little rough prior, and this synthetic fluid has smoothed it out! Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: John Cocktoasten

customer_reviews.title: 2010 Pathfinder drain and change worked out great and  smoother.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good in trans fluid drain and change on 2010 Nissan Pathfinder. Everyone said don’t since the car is newer and might cause problems take it to dealer, so on their name and good past experience with Royal’s oil I winged it. Haven’t looked back since.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor J.

customer_reviews.title: My tranny shift like a silk
customer_reviews.text: The best ATF fluid in the market. My transmission shift as smooth as silk. Buy the best and it gives you a peace of mind, knowing that your fluid won’t fail. In addition, I added two tubes of lubeguard dr. Tranny for more protection.
customer_reviews.author: OE Clemente

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Use this in both automatic transmissions of my 2000 4runner 2wd and 2001 Jeep Cherokee 4wd. Neither vehicle has any issues, over 400,000 miles between the two
customer_reviews.author: Devyn

customer_reviews.title: VERY GOOD..
customer_reviews.text: ONLY ONE I USE IN 2 GMC, 15,000 MILES. VERY GOOD...... ONE HAS 148.000 MILES.. FROME DAY 1 THAT ALL IT HAD ROYAL P.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas D. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Premium Transmission ATF
customer_reviews.text: I have used this on a 2002 Honda Accord and it works amazing even though old Honda transmission have been known for their infamous problems. I saved myself $100 buying MAX ATF and changing the fluid myself than paying someone else. After changing the fluid and taking it out for a drive, I noticed that transmission was humming and shifting much more smoothly than before. Two weeks later, I still feel the noticeable improvement, though it won't perform miracles and fix damage that might have already been done to your transmission, I might even say I'd prefer to put in Royal Purple ATF fluid than the OEM Honda Genuine fluid just because of the different experience with the two fluids.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Fix a less than smooth 1st to 2nd gear shift in a 6sp Tremec.
customer_reviews.text: I heard this product would improve the shift quality of my Challenger Tremec 6sp trans. It did and my "catchy 1st to 2nd shift" is buttery smooth. Imazing improvement...well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: J.N. Masters

customer_reviews.title: Car running smoother
customer_reviews.text: Royal purple is the top of the line ATF, it’s cheaper than most places, sadly I bought way too much for a full size sedan
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Tendean

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff! Nuff said... buy it!!
customer_reviews.text: Running it in the ‘99 Tacoma V6 with 180K miles and noticed an immediate change in the smoothness of the shifting.

customer_reviews.title: My Go To
customer_reviews.text: I have used RP on everything for over ten years My go to only thing I haven't used it on is my wife Jeep since we get two free oil changes a year from dealer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE it.
customer_reviews.text: 1998 Toyota Avalon 174K ... the transmission has been humming for about a year. Just replaced transmission fluid with Royal Purple Synthetic.... WOW very happy ... tranny quieted down and shifts smooth as silk... also running RP motor oil. High recommend.

customer_reviews.title: Love it

customer_reviews.text: Yeah, it's a bit pricey, but it's certainly the best. I won't use anything else.

customer_reviews.title: Best lubricant I have ever used for my vehicles
customer_reviews.text: I use Royal Purple exclusively on all my vehicles for all fluids. My experience, which is not to indicate can be repeated, was an improvement of 3 mpg on the highway when I replaced the stock ATF in my 2006 Cadillac CTS-V. I was in shock.

customer_reviews.text: No problems here in my E39 BMW after a new torque convertor was installed.

customer_reviews.text: I use this ATF in my 1999 Toyota Corolla and the car shifts more smoothly and consistently due to RP ATF. A good value for the price.

customer_reviews.text: as always top quality and advanced formula. Thumbs way up. Royal purple all the way on my trucks.

customer_reviews.title: Greaty product!
customer_reviews.text: Has my transmission rebuilt and added nothing but Royal Purple Trans fluid. Must say that the transmission runs smoother, gears enter smoother, and shifts better. Must have!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I have 03 Odyssey that started to shift hard after I have serviced tranny every 30k miles. Read online that many folks had super success usign this in conjunction with Magnefine Filter. I did drain and fill with this product a couple times and installed the Magnefine filter last time and the van shifts like new now (not exagerating). Shifts smoother than my 08 Altima. Would definetly suggest anyone to use this product. Agree a little pricey but well worth it...a few extra bucks for peace of mind and quality product to help protect and prolong the life of a transmission (that would cost $4000 to replace)...definetly worth it...extra $50 to use this to potentially save $4000 repair bill....no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: VW

customer_reviews.title: After ATF change at 90, 000 miles I noticed ...
customer_reviews.text: After ATF change at 90,000 miles I noticed smoother shifts and less noise in the cab of the truck. My transmission runs about 15 degrees cooler. I will continue to use Royal Purple products.

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: My husband told me this was an excellent price for a top notch product. He highly recommends this for all wheel drive vehicles. Definitely will be purchasing it here again.

customer_reviews.title: Royal Purple for life!
customer_reviews.text: After using this, you will never want to use others! You will notice significant improvement after first use! I'm a royal purple for life!

customer_reviews.title: Royal Purple Max ATF
customer_reviews.text: Royal Purple products are excellent. A friend who works for a large oil refinery got me started using Royal Purple oil. He is the refinery oil analysis expert. Since the refinery switched to Royal Purple in their machinery, they have saved millions upon millions of dollars in equipment repairs and a dramatic reduction of plant down time. I have notice several mile to the gallon increase in fuel mileage in my vehicles, since I switched to Royal Purple. Initially, Royal Purple may seem more expensive but the frequency of fluid changes and decrease in fuel consumption more than pays for the product.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: Top quality stuff. Put this in my 231 transfer ...
customer_reviews.text: Top quality stuff. Put this in my 231 transfer case on my jeep yj. Nothing beats royal purple

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stuff!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great trans fluid, smoother shifts, smoother acelleration, fixed hard shifts, and it increased my mpg by 2 (every mile counts)

customer_reviews.title: ... it but I am not sure which one is better. I think the transmission is more responsive with ...
customer_reviews.text: Was using Mobil 1 AFT but switched to Royal Purple just to try it but I am not sure which one is better. I think the transmission is more responsive with RP vs. Mobil 1. I know the RP fan boys will say it's better. So far my 4runner has 240K miles with the original engine and transmission. From day 1 with 10miles I brought it home, drained the engine, AT, transfer case and rear diff and refilled everything with Mobil 1. Engine is still using Mobil1 but I switched the AT, diff and transfer case to RP about 30k miles ago.
customer_reviews.author: ronald m.

customer_reviews.title: and it shifts like there's no transition between gears at all
customer_reviews.text: Transmission feels smooth as silk now, and it shifts like there's no transition between gears at all!

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.......
customer_reviews.text: Worth the extra money! If you are going to go through the trouble to change your fluid in the tyranny, put the best you can into it. You might spend an extra $20-30 now, but that can buy you months if not many more miles on your newer transmission. My original factory fluid had 50K on it with a definite burnt smell. Had moved and pulled way to much weight over the mountains. On my first test drive with this fluid, it was like driving a brand new vehicle (2007 Jeep JK). Don't second guess. You won't regret this cheap investment into your vehicle. It really is as good as everyone else states.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisInCO

customer_reviews.title: Great fluid!

customer_reviews.title: Too soon to tell...
customer_reviews.text: I drive my cars very rough, so I figured I should add the best in my cars. Since Royal Purple started taking out all the good stuff out of their regular over the counter products they sell at your local store I started upgrading all my OILS and ATF stuff. I use full synthetic HPS oil now and anything high quality for the transmission. I figured the additives will keep the engine clean, transm. going longer... So far so good... Will update my next change.
customer_reviews.author: Enigma Networks

customer_reviews.title: Good ATF fluid for 540i power steering
customer_reviews.text: Used to top off power steering fluid in my 97 BMW 540i. Steering still feels good so it must be the right kind!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works better then expected in my 2002 Dodge ram 1500 4x4 great product

customer_reviews.title: after flushing the dirty black oil out of the tranny and replacing it ...
customer_reviews.text: It was time to replace trans fluid in the 08 fusion. Tranny calls for Ford FNR5 fluid, cost was about the same so I ended up buying RP Max ATF, after flushing the dirty black oil out of the tranny and replacing it with this clean red oil it eliminated the hard shift from 1st to 2nd and cleared up the rough idle when in gear and stopped. I love RP products and would recommend them to everyone. Been driving the Fusion to work for 3-4 days now and gas mileage is improving. Next up for RP products is the 2015 Chally R/T ScatPack-manual trans and rear diff.
customer_reviews.author: C-lo

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: My 2007 Silverado had a rough shift between first and second. Now it's smooth after sucking out original fluid and refilling with Royal Purple ATF. Got 3 quarts out each iteration, and repeated 3 times. The tranny dipstick says "Dextron VI Only" but this tranny (4L60-E) has been around long before Dextron VI, which was developed for the newer 6 speed tranny. GM bought out distributors of the Dextron VI so they want everyone to buy their stuff. It also appears that the engine is not revving as much, indicating better fuel economy.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: Best you can buy!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff made tranny run cooler and smoother. And that was with just a pan drop and filter change.
customer_reviews.author: Dano

customer_reviews.title: Used in my 03 F150
customer_reviews.text: Flushed my 03 F150 transmission and used the Royal Purple in place of Dextron 5. Transmission now shifts as good or better than it ever has.
customer_reviews.author: Charles W Brown

customer_reviews.title: Best decision ever to put this in my Jeep
customer_reviews.text: Best decision ever to put this in my Jeep!!! My JKUR is running smoother than when I originally bought it.
customer_reviews.author: william gager

customer_reviews.title: 2015 MUSTANG GT 6R80
customer_reviews.text: Got his stuff to replace the stock ford MERCON lv after 7000 miles. I did not like the way the car shifted before I put the purple drank in it. I drop the tranny and the fluid was black and stunk like crap 7k miles. Ford claims it's filled for life. Get ford MERCON lv out of your car. Put this stuff in and and my car shifts better, smoother and my tranny temp never goes over 199f now. So worth the money thank you Royal purple.
customer_reviews.author: J4

customer_reviews.title: Amazing !
customer_reviews.text: I have an 88 Nissan 300zx with 170k miles on it , so i changed the filter and fluid and noticed an immediate difference in the smoothness of the gears shifting , always had the OverDrive button pushed in before because it would shift late and build up high R's before it would shift , now i dont even use OD button unless i am on the freeway .Its like having a new transmission !!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: A good deal on the Best Oil available on the market
customer_reviews.text: A good deal on the Best Oil available on the market. Give your vehicle the best and it will treat you as you treat it....

customer_reviews.title: Fixed the hard shifting in my tranny. I'm only ...
customer_reviews.text: Fixed the hard shifting in my tranny. I'm only going to use Royal Purple on my cars from now on!

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: With all the synthetic ATF fluids available, I was drawn to this product for several reasons. The brand was recommended by a BMW mechanic and it offers a wide range of compatibilities with legacy fluids like DEX III.
customer_reviews.author: Still Trying

customer_reviews.title: It's Royal Purple...enough said
customer_reviews.text: Swapped out transmission fluid from regular Dexron III to Royal Purple Max ATF at 100,000 miles. The RP Max ATF has made a noticeable difference in the transmission performance. Unfortunately, at almost $15 a quart you will find yourself waiting extra time for every last drip to come out of the bottle. Now considering how often transmission fluid gets replaced and how much punishment it takes, a few extra dollars now may save you a lot of dollars later.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C.

customer_reviews.title: stewart
customer_reviews.text: Excellant product I replaced the fluids in my Infiniti M35X 2006 and have done 100,000km since, just had the fluids checked by my trusted mechanic and everything is perfect. I thought I might have to change the fluids but probably will get another 100,000km before we change them once again.
customer_reviews.author: stewart

customer_reviews.title: The best protection for tranny
customer_reviews.text: I instantly felt smoother shifts after having my mechanic pump in royal purple and cycle out old fluid,if you go the expense of RP go the extra expense of back pumping it into your tranny and torque converter, you will never get the old fluid out of the torque converter by simply draining your tranny.worth the money

customer_reviews.title: 04 Grand Prix GT2
customer_reviews.text: Did the fluid and filter at 135,000 miles and after 10,000 it’s still going strong. On average I’m 15 degrees cooler than before and it seems to like shifting more lol smoother at WOT. Will be buying again for my other cars when they come due.

customer_reviews.title: Seem to be a good product.
customer_reviews.text: first time giving this ATF a try. so far so good. I put this in a van I just bought. The shifting seems to preform a little better, but honestly I do not know if it is the ATF or the fact the old ATF had not been changed in 25k miles.

customer_reviews.title: Royal Purple is all I use in my Subaru Forester ...
customer_reviews.text: Royal Purple is all I use in my Subaru Forester. Do to the travel with my job I put 72,00 miles a year on my vehicle. Royal Purple keeps my transmission going and shifting smooth!

customer_reviews.text: I use this in my diesel pusher motorhome with Allison transmission. No problems after a couple of years. Exceeds Allison requirements in all facets.

customer_reviews.text: These products speak for themselves. they have great reviews and we have been very pleased with the vehicles performance as well. We will be using these products for all future oil and transmission fluid changes.

customer_reviews.title: Can't tell the car shifts!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just changed the strainer/filter and fluid on my 04 sentra w/ 109k miles. It stayed in lower gear for a second or 2 then shifted hard before the fluid change. Let me just say now I can't even feel it shift even if it downshifts at high revs! Awesome fluid and worth the $15 a bottle. You will thank yourself after it's in you vehicle. I just dropped another 100 to change out the fluid on my wife's scion next weekend!!! JUST ORDER SOME!

customer_reviews.title: This stuff rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Can totally tell the difference in my tranny. Great stuff used by racers and regular drivers. Ask around- The best!
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I have a 08 dodge with a 6.7 cummins in it I serviced both the trans and the power stering system, i have a bigger trans pan . this added about 4 quarts and the power stering is another 5 with the flush. so this is a expensive service . got all the oil in about a week. works great
customer_reviews.author: GregJoneson

customer_reviews.title: but worth a try if results not good with other fluids
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my Honda CR-V with 100K miles. I had drained and refilled with Honda ATF twice and the shifting was sometimes delayed and not smooth between second and third. I used 3 quarts of this Royal Purple and the results were impressive. Shifting is now very smooth and the transmission overall much smoother. I will buy another 3 quarts for another drain and refill. It's expensive, but worth a try if results not good with other fluids.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Hutchinson

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best synthetic ATF and engine oil products you can buy
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best synthetic ATF and engine oil products you can buy. Distinct and obvious improvement of my Titan's transmission using this product.
customer_reviews.author: KGB

customer_reviews.title: BEST AFT
customer_reviews.text: I used this in my 2004 Dodge 3500 Cummins with automatic transmission. I used T-Tech fluid transmission machine to exchange the fluid in the transmission and torque converter. The transmission was experiencing a slight jerk but after exchange, the transmission shifted extreme smooth. 50,000 miles later, the transmission still shifts smooth. Electronic transmission are very sensitive to fluid contamination.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Structural Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Lube It Up!
customer_reviews.text: Every mechanic and oil change place I've gone to responded "Royal Purple" when I asked what was the best oil I could buy online. So...I did. I was astounded at the positive change in my engine's performance and will *never* go back to any other oil. Yes, it's pricey, but this is my car's engine and I don't care about oil prices when it comes to that.

customer_reviews.title: royal purple has got to be one of the top ...
customer_reviews.text: royal purple has got to be one of the top 5 so you can't go wrong with this product i got it for my 2008 dodge charger STR8 superbee and i felt the difference right off the lot
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I've been using their oil for a while, and have had great experience, and this did not let me down either
customer_reviews.author: archemedes

customer_reviews.title: royal purple atf
customer_reviews.text: I had used amsoil ATF prior to this. car ran fine for about 20k miles the. for the last 10k the car wouldn't shift smoothly into any gear. I have a 2004 infiniti i35 wich is a four speed automatic. so the car would kick each shift. also started getting some vibration at highway speeds. once I changed over to the royal purple atf the vibration at highway speeds went away and the shifts became a lot smoother. except from first to second that always had a slight kick to it but it was better then before. I've been running the car for 1000 miles so we'll see if it has the same results as the amsoil. hopefully not.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar Berber

customer_reviews.title: RP or Amsoil
customer_reviews.text: This debate just goes on and on...i don't know which is better. I have RP running in my transfer case and Amsoil in my tranny. Can i tell a difference? NOPE! They both seem to have great specs on paper with Amsoil has a slight edge on the viscosity around 100C degree, other than that, they are pretty much the same. Both are synthetic. The only difference is RP is actually purple in color and you can get it off of Amazon. Amsoil, you have to buy direct.
customer_reviews.author: Dieselboy

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Only Transmission fluid I will ever buy. Works well for my older car

product_meta.title: Royal Purple 06320-6PK Max ATF High Performance Synthetic Automatic Transmission Fluid - 1 qt. (Case of 6)
product_meta.description: Size:1 Quart, Case of 6Royal Purple Max ATF High Performance Multi-Spec Synthetic Automatic Transmission Fluid is a synthetic, high performance, automatic transmission fluid. Its high film strength helps to dramatically reduce heat and wear. Automatic transmissions generate a great deal of heat and depend on the transmission fluid for cooling and protection. More than 90 percent of all automatic transmission failures are caused by overheating. A 20 degree Fahrenheit reduction in fluid temperature can double the life of the transmission. Max ATF significantly reduces heat to extend the life of your transmission. Max ATF is fully compatible and can be mixed with other automatic transmission fluids; however, for the best results drain or flush the current oil and then fill with Max ATF.
feature_bullets: High Film Strength Helps to Dramatically Reduce Heat and Wear
Automatic Transmissions Generate a Great Deal of Heat and Depend on Transmission Fluid for Cooling and Protection
Significantly Reduces Heat to Extend the Life of Your Transmission
Fully Compatible and Can Be Mixed with Other Automatic Transmission Fluids
